[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization failure] If ListManager::new() fails at line 21, does the error propagation properly prevent the faucet service from starting with an insecure configuration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Panic safety] Can malformed header values cause unwrap() or panic in the to_str() or split_whitespace() operations, leading to denial of service of the faucet? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Result handling] Does returning Ok(false) vs Ok(true) provide sufficient information to upstream callers, or can error cases be confused with authorization failures, leading to security decisions based on incorrect assumptions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Inverted logic] Is the return Ok(false) at line 35 when X_IS_JWT_HEADER is present the correct behavior, or should it return an error to prevent JWT requests from accidentally falling through to other bypassers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Short-circuit bypass] Does returning Ok(false) at line 45 when no Authorization header is present allow other bypassers to be checked, or should it explicitly reject the request? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Authorization priority] Is the order of checks (X_IS_JWT_HEADER first, then Authorization) correct, or can this be exploited to bypass security by manipulating header order? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Negative match handling] When manager.contains() returns false, does returning Ok(false) properly communicate to upstream code that this bypasser cannot authorize the request, or can it be misinterpreted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Token exposure] Are the loaded auth tokens logged by the info! macro at line 22-25, potentially exposing sensitive bypass tokens in system logs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Token counting leak] Does the manager.num_items() call at line 24 leak information about the number of bypass tokens to attackers who can access logs, aiding in enumeration attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Struct: AuthTokenBypasser] [Token lifetime] Does the ListManager hold tokens in memory for the entire lifetime of the faucet service, and can this lead to memory leaks if tokens are never removed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Token reloading] Is there a mechanism to reload the token list without restarting the service, or can attackers exploit stale tokens that should have been revoked? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Struct: AuthTokenBypasser] [Token persistence] Are bypass tokens stored only in memory in the ListManager.items HashSet, making them vulnerable to loss during service restarts or crashes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Trait: BypasserTrait] [Trait implementation] Does the async trait implementation at line 30-31 properly handle errors from other implementations, or can error handling differences cause security issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Bypasser ordering] When multiple bypassers are configured, can the AuthTokenBypasser's behavior interact with other bypassers in unexpected ways that bypass security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [CheckerData validation] Does the function validate all fields in CheckerData (receiver, source_ip, headers), or does it only check headers, allowing attackers with invalid addresses or IPs to bypass checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Checker bypass interaction] If this bypasser returns true, are ALL checkers skipped including rate limiting and IP blocklists, potentially allowing abuse of the faucet service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Storage bypass interaction] When returning true, does the bypass also skip storage of the funding transaction, preventing audit trails and enabling repeated abuse? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header duplication] Can an attacker send multiple Authorization headers or multiple X_IS_JWT_HEADER headers to cause the HeaderMap to behave unexpectedly, bypassing the checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header order dependency] Does the function rely on a specific header order in the HeaderMap, and can attackers manipulate this order to affect the authorization decision? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [HTTP/2 pseudo-headers] Can attackers exploit HTTP/2 pseudo-headers or header encoding differences to inject or manipulate the Authorization or X_IS_JWT_HEADER values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: request_can_bypass()] [Header value encoding] Does the HeaderMap properly decode percent-encoded, base64-encoded, or other encoded header values before the checks, or can encoding bypass the validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Default configuration] If ListManagerConfig is not properly initialized, does the new() function fail safely or could it create an AuthTokenBypasser that accepts all tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [File path validation] Does the ListManagerConfig validate that the token file path is within expected directories, or can path traversal allow loading tokens from arbitrary locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/bypasser/auth_token.rs] [Function: new()] [Empty token list] If the token file is empty or contains only comments, does the ListManager still function correctly, or can this lead to unexpected bypass behavior? (Medium)
